Name: DXOS
Description: DXOS is an open source framework for building real-time, collaborative web applications.

Protocol.comment: P2P connections are made via WebRTC, and client-server connections are made via WebSockets.

Topology.comment: Always available data optionally provided by server-based peers.

LocalRefreshLatency.comment: Data is stored as Automerge documents under the hood.

SchemaManagement.comment: Schemas are defined using Effect Schema, and are validated on write. Migrations are supported at the object level.

DataSize.comment: Objects are Automerge documents under the hood.

FullOrPartialReplication.comment: Full replication of all spaces joined per identity.

ConflictHandling.comment: Automerge is the CRDT used under the hood.

WhatGetsSynced.comment: Automerge is the CRDT used under the hood.

Encryption.comment: Data is not currently encrypted at rest. E2EE is planned via Keyhive.

RichTextEditing.comment: Anything compatible with Automerge documents (e.g. CodeMirror, ProseMirror, etc.)

Components.comment: React components for performing invitations are provided. SDK provides which peers you are connected to.

CLI.data: CLI which contains a full client and commands for managing identities, spaces, etc.

TypeSupport.data: Full type support via Effect Schema
